author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
In contrast to the past when Pakistan has refused to issue visas to mainstream leaders from Kashmir, the Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) administration on Thursday invited two mainstream leaders, besides separatists, for a conference to the held in Islamabad.

PoK President Sardar Muhammad Yaqub Khan has invited Awami Ittehad Party chief and legislator Engineer Rasheed and CPI(M) legislator Muhammad Yousuf Tarigami, to attend a two-day roundtable conference to discuss the Kashmir problem.

Topics for discussion

The discussion is being held at the Convention Centre in Islamabad on January 20 and 21.

The invitees have been asked to throw light on topics such as, “Kashmir conflict: its ramifications for Indo-Pak relations and peace; Kashmir dispute: Hindutva and the emergence of Hindu extremism in India; and, the proposed abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A of the Indian Constitution and its impact on the Kashmir dispute”.

All top senior separatist leaders, including Syed Ali Geelani, Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, and Aga Syed Hasan, have been invited.

Mr.Tarigami said, “I am yet to decide whether to go or not”.

In August last year, Pakistan dropped the name of Jammu and Kashmir Assembly Speaker Kavinder Gupta from the list of invitees to the Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference in Pakistan.

Similarly, the People’s Democratic Party was also denied visa by Pakistan last year for a conference.
title: PoK invites J&K leaders for meet in Islamabad
